intro: Fraxinus ovalis, commonly known as the oval ash, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters with a broad, rounded crown. The leaves are simple, opposite, and oval in shape, with a smooth margin and a serrated edge. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers appear in clusters in early spring, followed by winged seeds in the fall. The bark is smooth and grayish-white, becoming fissured with age.
